discovery.text: The spike in acute-to-chronic workload ratio is the key predictor. It measures recent load versus recent average.

twist.text: Doing nothing for weeks then suddenly training hard is riskier than consistent moderate training. Inconsistency injures.

climax.text: Gradual, consistent progression is the single most effective injury prevention strategy that exists.

punchline.text: Most injuries are training errors, not bad luck. Patient progress prevents them.
